text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with oven grilled parsnips that's
right I had some grilled parsnips a
while back and I really enjoyed them so
I wanted to try to simulate that
beautiful charred edge caramelization in
the oven and it actually worked out very
well and I know a lot of you were
thinking I like mine just boiled and
mashed plane with hardly any seasoning
well I realized that is incredibly
delicious but this is even better so
here we go step one we're gonna need
some parsnips and there's mine I have
five they're all clearly suffering from
the subterranean homesick blues you know
you really don't get enough Dylan
references and today's recipe videos but
anyway I got about two pounds of
parsnips we're gonna go ahead and peel
those of course and I realize a lot of
people roast these with the skin on
which I don't like I think it's too
bitter but suit yourself alright when it
comes to the roots the game theory is up
to you so once those are peeled we're
gonna go ahead and cut off the top cut
off the tip so that bottom half because
it tapers down and is much smaller we're
gonna go ahead and cut that in half so
there's two pieces and then to sort of
simulate the same shape and size with
the top we're gonna cut that in half and
if we turn that like that and just cut
that in three pieces
everything should be similarly shaped
and sized and of course it's never going
to be perfect so don't try to make it
perfect you just drive yourself crazy
and then your family will have to
explain to people that you went crazy
over parsnips that's not a great story
so just relax cut them up and then once
we have all those cut we're going to
simply throw them in a bowl and squeeze
over lemon juice so I squeezed in one
very juicy lemon and it's the lemon
juice along with the very hot oven
that's going to kind of simulate that
grilled effect on the parsnips so we're
gonna squeeze in some lemon juice we're
also gonna give it a nice dousing of
olive oil and then we will generously
season this up with some freshly ground
black pepper some kosher salt and some
Aleppo pepper and yes it's kind of a new
ingredient around here you can read
about that on the blog really nice
pepper
sorry Cayenne I still love you and then
we're gonna give all that a toss very
thoroughly and what I like to do is I
like to give it a toss let it sit for
three or four minutes give it another
toss let it sit for a couple minutes and
then give it another toss because we got
a lot of dressing in there and part of
it was I had a really juicy lemon but
that's okay so I'm gonna give it time to
soak in so I'll toss mine a couple times
and once you've tossed the parsnips
you're
go ahead and put those on a lined baking
sheet I'm used to baking mat but you
could use foil it works and once you
space those out evenly those are gonna
go in a very hot preheated oven we're
gonna go 450 degrees
we'll go for 15 minutes and at that
point we'll pull it out give them a flip
and even though it doesn't look like
they're doing much yet they are
softening getting tender and what's
gonna happen we're gonna put them back
in for another 15 to 20 minutes and
that's where all the magic
caramelization is gonna happen and by
the way if you're playing the kick the
tripod drinking game you got to do a
shot okay so they go back in 15 or 20
minutes and they're gonna look like this
hopefully those sugars and starches in
the parsnips along with the lemon juice
are gonna help these caramelize and
they're gonna get those little charred
edges that look just like they came off
a grill I think it looks really cool
while these are still warm I'm gonna
give them just a little extra salt so
I'm gonna give those a toss and I
believe those would be ready to enjoy I
originally intended for this to be a
vegetable side dish video but after they
came out they look so beautiful and
caramelized and gorgeous I decided to
turn it into a parsnip based snack food
so I'm gonna serve these just like fries
with a dip so I'm gonna pile those on a
platter that is just a very simple
anchovy and parsley aioli yes of course
I will show you that so easy so let me
grab one of these beauties and dip it in
and instead of watching the plate I was
actually looking in the viewfinder so I
couldn't quite find the mark but
eventually there we go and that really
really was delicious parsnips are kind
of a cross between a carrot and a potato
with a little bit of that anisette
fennel kind of background flavor some
people find the texture too fibrous
doesn't bother me at all
and by the way fair warning that lemon
juice on the outside will actually make
those fibers a little tougher it's a
chemistry thing but like I said it
doesn't bother me the surface will have
a little bit of a bite to it but the
inside should be soft it should be
tender sweet succulent and very very
delicious who knows these could replace
french fries in your diet there's a you
know a chance so if you've never thought
about making parsnips is a Dibble party
food this oven grilled version could
give you a reason so I really do hope
you give these a try head over to food
wishes comm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info
usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
